segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile and mobile device management (Windows 10)
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile and mobile device management (Windows 10)

segment.source: This guide provides an overview of the mobile device and app management technologies in the Windows 10 Mobile operating system.
segment.target: This guide provides an overview of the mobile device and app management technologies in the Windows 10 Mobile operating system.

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile and mobile device management
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile and mobile device management

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile

segment.source: This guide provides an overview of the mobile device and app management technologies in the Windows 10 Mobile operating system.
segment.target: This guide provides an overview of the mobile device and app management technologies in the Windows 10 Mobile operating system.

segment.source: It describes how mobile device management (MDM) systems use the built-in device management client to deploy, configure, maintain, and support phones and small tablets running Windows 10 Mobile.
segment.target: It describes how mobile device management (MDM) systems use the built-in device management client to deploy, configure, maintain, and support phones and small tablets running Windows 10 Mobile.

segment.source: Bring Your Own Device (BYOD—that is, personal devices) and corporate devices are key scenarios that Windows 10 Mobile MDM capabilities support.
segment.target: Bring Your Own Device (BYOD—that is, personal devices) and corporate devices are key scenarios that Windows 10 Mobile MDM capabilities support.

segment.source: The operating system offers a flexible approach to registering devices with directory services and MDM systems, and IT organizations can provision comprehensive device-configuration profiles based on their company’s need to control and secure mobile business data.
segment.target: The operating system offers a flexible approach to registering devices with directory services and MDM systems, and IT organizations can provision comprehensive device-configuration profiles based on their company’s need to control and secure mobile business data.

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile not only delivers more comprehensive, restrictive configuration settings than Windows Phone 8.1 did but also provides capabilities to deploy and manage apps built on the Universal Windows Platform (UWP).
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile not only delivers more comprehensive, restrictive configuration settings than Windows Phone 8.1 did but also provides capabilities to deploy and manage apps built on the Universal Windows Platform (UWP).

segment.source: Companies can distribute apps directly from Windows Store or by using their MDM system.
segment.target: Companies can distribute apps directly from Windows Store or by using their MDM system.

segment.source: They can control and distribute custom line-of-business (LOB) apps the same way.
segment.target: They can control and distribute custom line-of-business (LOB) apps the same way.

segment.source: Overview
segment.target: Overview

segment.source: Organizations’ users increasingly depend on their mobile devices, but phones and tablets bring new and unfamiliar challenges for IT departments.
segment.target: Organizations’ users increasingly depend on their mobile devices, but phones and tablets bring new and unfamiliar challenges for IT departments.

segment.source: IT must be able to deploy and manage mobile devices and apps quickly to support the business while balancing the growing need to protect corporate data because of evolving laws, regulations, and cybercrime.
segment.target: IT must be able to deploy and manage mobile devices and apps quickly to support the business while balancing the growing need to protect corporate data because of evolving laws, regulations, and cybercrime.

segment.source: IT must ensure that the apps and data on those mobile devices are safe, especially on personal devices.
segment.target: IT must ensure that the apps and data on those mobile devices are safe, especially on personal devices.

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile helps organizations address these challenges by providing a robust, flexible, built-in MDM client.
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile helps organizations address these challenges by providing a robust, flexible, built-in MDM client.

segment.source: IT departments can use the MDM system of their choice to manage this client.
segment.target: IT departments can use the MDM system of their choice to manage this client.

segment.source: Built-in MDM client
segment.target: Built-in MDM client

segment.source: The built-in MDM client is common to all editions of the Windows 10 operating system, including desktop, mobile, and Internet of Things (IoT).
segment.target: The built-in MDM client is common to all editions of the Windows 10 operating system, including desktop, mobile, and Internet of Things (IoT).

segment.source: The client provides a single interface through which you can manage any device that runs Windows 10.
segment.target: The client provides a single interface through which you can manage any device that runs Windows 10.

segment.source: The client has two important roles: device enrollment in an MDM system and device management.
segment.target: The client has two important roles: device enrollment in an MDM system and device management.

segment.source: Device enrollment.
segment.target: Device enrollment.

segment.source: Users can enroll in the MDM system.
segment.target: Users can enroll in the MDM system.

segment.source: On Windows 10, a user can register a device with Microsoft Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) and enroll in an MDM system at the same time so that the system can manage the device, the apps running on it, and the confidential data it holds.
segment.target: On Windows 10, a user can register a device with Microsoft Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) and enroll in an MDM system at the same time so that the system can manage the device, the apps running on it, and the confidential data it holds.

segment.source: Enrollment establishes the management authority for the device.
segment.target: Enrollment establishes the management authority for the device.

segment.source: Only one management authority (or MDM enrollment) is possible at a time, which helps prevent unauthorized access to devices and ensures their stability and reliability.
segment.target: Only one management authority (or MDM enrollment) is possible at a time, which helps prevent unauthorized access to devices and ensures their stability and reliability.

segment.source: Device management.
segment.target: Device management.

segment.source: The MDM client allows the MDM system to configure policy settings; deploy apps and updates; and perform other management tasks, such as remotely wiping the device.
segment.target: The MDM client allows the MDM system to configure policy settings; deploy apps and updates; and perform other management tasks, such as remotely wiping the device.

segment.source: The MDM system sends configuration requests and collects inventory through the MDM client.
segment.target: The MDM system sends configuration requests and collects inventory through the MDM client.

segment.source: The client uses configuration service providers (CSPs) to configure and inventory settings.
segment.target: The client uses configuration service providers (CSPs) to configure and inventory settings.

segment.source: A CSP is an interface to read, set, modify, or delete configuration settings on the device.
segment.target: A CSP is an interface to read, set, modify, or delete configuration settings on the device.

segment.source: These settings map to registry keys or files.
segment.target: These settings map to registry keys or files.

segment.source: (The security architecture of Windows 10 Mobile prevents direct access to registry settings and operating system files.
segment.target: (The security architecture of Windows 10 Mobile prevents direct access to registry settings and operating system files.

segment.source: For more information, see the Windows 10 Mobile security guide.)
segment.target: For more information, see the Windows 10 Mobile security guide.)

segment.source: The MDM client is an integral part of Windows 10 Mobile.
segment.target: The MDM client is an integral part of Windows 10 Mobile.

segment.source: As a result, there is no need for an additional, custom MDM app to enroll the device or to allow an MDM system to manage it.
segment.target: As a result, there is no need for an additional, custom MDM app to enroll the device or to allow an MDM system to manage it.

segment.source: All MDM systems have equal access to Windows 10 Mobile MDM application programming interfaces (APIs), so you can choose Microsoft Intune or a third-party MDM product to manage Windows 10 Mobile devices.
segment.target: All MDM systems have equal access to Windows 10 Mobile MDM application programming interfaces (APIs), so you can choose Microsoft Intune or a third-party MDM product to manage Windows 10 Mobile devices.

segment.source: For more information about Windows 10 Mobile device management APIs, see Mobile device management.
segment.target: For more information about Windows 10 Mobile device management APIs, see Mobile device management.

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile editions
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile editions

segment.source: Every device that runs Windows 10 Mobile includes all the enterprise mobile device security and management capabilities the MDM client provides.
segment.target: Every device that runs Windows 10 Mobile includes all the enterprise mobile device security and management capabilities the MDM client provides.

segment.source: Microsoft also offers an Enterprise edition of Windows 10 Mobile, which includes three additional capabilities.
segment.target: Microsoft also offers an Enterprise edition of Windows 10 Mobile, which includes three additional capabilities.

segment.source: To enable these capabilities, you can provision a license file without reinstalling the operating system:
segment.target: To enable these capabilities, you can provision a license file without reinstalling the operating system:

segment.source: Ability to postpone software updates.Windows 10 Mobile gets software updates directly from Windows Update, and you cannot curate updates prior to deployment.
segment.target: Ability to postpone software updates.Windows 10 Mobile gets software updates directly from Windows Update, and you cannot curate updates prior to deployment.

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile Enterprise, however, allows you to curate and validate updates prior to deploying them.
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile Enterprise, however, allows you to curate and validate updates prior to deploying them.

segment.source: No limit on the number of self-signed LOB apps that you can deploy to a single device.
segment.target: No limit on the number of self-signed LOB apps that you can deploy to a single device.

segment.source: To use an MDM system to deploy LOB apps directly to devices, you must cryptographically sign the software packages with a code signing certificate that your organization’s certificate authority (CA) generates.
segment.target: To use an MDM system to deploy LOB apps directly to devices, you must cryptographically sign the software packages with a code signing certificate that your organization’s certificate authority (CA) generates.

segment.source: You can deploy a maximum of 20 self-signed LOB apps to a Windows 10 Mobile device, more than 20 if your organization’s devices run Windows 10 Mobile Enterprise.
segment.target: You can deploy a maximum of 20 self-signed LOB apps to a Windows 10 Mobile device, more than 20 if your organization’s devices run Windows 10 Mobile Enterprise.

segment.source: Set telemetry to security level.
segment.target: Set telemetry to security level.

segment.source: The telemetry security level configures the operating system to gather only the telemetry information required to keep devices secured.
segment.target: The telemetry security level configures the operating system to gather only the telemetry information required to keep devices secured.

segment.source: Note: Your organization can opt to purchase a code signing certificate from Verisign to sign LOB apps or use Windows Store for Business to obtain apps.
segment.target: Note: Your organization can opt to purchase a code signing certificate from Verisign to sign LOB apps or use Windows Store for Business to obtain apps.

segment.source: With either method, you can distribute more than 20 apps to a single device without activating Windows 10 Mobile Enterprise on that device by using your MDM system.
segment.target: With either method, you can distribute more than 20 apps to a single device without activating Windows 10 Mobile Enterprise on that device by using your MDM system.

segment.source: To activate Windows 10 Mobile Enterprise on any Windows 10 Mobile device, use your company’s MDM system or a provisioning package to inject a license onto the device.
segment.target: To activate Windows 10 Mobile Enterprise on any Windows 10 Mobile device, use your company’s MDM system or a provisioning package to inject a license onto the device.

segment.source: You can download a Windows 10 Mobile Enterprise license from the Business Support Portal.
segment.target: You can download a Windows 10 Mobile Enterprise license from the Business Support Portal.

segment.source: Lifecycle management
segment.target: Lifecycle management

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile supports end-to-end lifecycle device management to give companies control of their devices, data, and apps.
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile supports end-to-end lifecycle device management to give companies control of their devices, data, and apps.

segment.source: Comprehensive MDM systems use the built-in MDM client to manage devices throughout their lifecycle, as Figure 1 illustrates.
segment.target: Comprehensive MDM systems use the built-in MDM client to manage devices throughout their lifecycle, as Figure 1 illustrates.

segment.source: The remainder of this guide describes the operating system’s mobile device and app management capabilities through each phase of the lifecycle, showing how MDM systems use specific features.
segment.target: The remainder of this guide describes the operating system’s mobile device and app management capabilities through each phase of the lifecycle, showing how MDM systems use specific features.

segment.target: figure 1

segment.source: Device management lifecycle
segment.target: Device management lifecycle

segment.source: Device deployment
segment.target: Device deployment

segment.source: Device deployment includes the initial registration and configuration of the device, including its enrollment with an MDM system.
segment.target: Device deployment includes the initial registration and configuration of the device, including its enrollment with an MDM system.

segment.source: Sometimes, companies preinstall apps.
segment.target: Sometimes, companies preinstall apps.

segment.source: The major factors in how you deploy devices and which controls you put in place are device ownership and how the user will use the device.
segment.target: The major factors in how you deploy devices and which controls you put in place are device ownership and how the user will use the device.

segment.source: This guide covers two scenarios:
segment.target: This guide covers two scenarios:

segment.source: Companies allow users to personalize their devices because the users own the devices or because company policy doesn’t require tight controls (defined as personal devices in this guide).
segment.target: Companies allow users to personalize their devices because the users own the devices or because company policy doesn’t require tight controls (defined as personal devices in this guide).

segment.source: Companies don’t allow users to personalize their devices or they limit personalization, usually because the organization owns the devices and security considerations are high (defined as corporate devices in this guide).
segment.target: Companies don’t allow users to personalize their devices or they limit personalization, usually because the organization owns the devices and security considerations are high (defined as corporate devices in this guide).

segment.source: Often, employees can choose devices from a list of supported models, or companies provide devices that they preconfigure, or bootstrap, with a baseline configuration.
segment.target: Often, employees can choose devices from a list of supported models, or companies provide devices that they preconfigure, or bootstrap, with a baseline configuration.

segment.source: Microsoft recommends Azure AD Join and MDM enrollment and management for corporate devices and Azure AD Registration and MDM enrollment and management for personal devices.
segment.target: Microsoft recommends Azure AD Join and MDM enrollment and management for corporate devices and Azure AD Registration and MDM enrollment and management for personal devices.

segment.source: Deployment scenarios
segment.target: Deployment scenarios

segment.source: Most organizations support both personal and corporate device scenarios.
segment.target: Most organizations support both personal and corporate device scenarios.

segment.source: The infrastructure for these scenarios is similar, but the deployment process and configuration policies differ.
segment.target: The infrastructure for these scenarios is similar, but the deployment process and configuration policies differ.

segment.source: Table 1 describes characteristics of the personal and corporate device scenarios.
segment.target: Table 1 describes characteristics of the personal and corporate device scenarios.

segment.target: Activation of a device with an organizational identity is unique to Windows 10 Mobile.

segment.source: Deployment

segment.source: The primary identity on the device is a personal identity.
segment.target: The primary identity on the device is a personal identity.

segment.source: A Microsoft account is the default option for Windows 10 Mobile.
segment.target: A Microsoft account is the default option for Windows 10 Mobile.

segment.source: The primary identity on the device is an organizational identity.
segment.target: The primary identity on the device is an organizational identity.

segment.source: An Azure AD account is the default option for Windows 10 Mobile.
segment.target: An Azure AD account is the default option for Windows 10 Mobile.

segment.source: Identity management
segment.target: Identity management

segment.source: People can use only one account to activate a device, so it’s imperative that your organization control which account you enable first.
segment.target: People can use only one account to activate a device, so it’s imperative that your organization control which account you enable first.

segment.source: The account you choose will determine who controls the device and influence your management capabilities.
segment.target: The account you choose will determine who controls the device and influence your management capabilities.

segment.source: The following list describes the impact that users’ identities have on management (Table 2 summarizes these considerations):
segment.target: The following list describes the impact that users’ identities have on management (Table 2 summarizes these considerations):

segment.source: Personal identity.
segment.target: Personal identity.

segment.source: In this scenario, employees use their Microsoft account to activate the device.
segment.target: In this scenario, employees use their Microsoft account to activate the device.

segment.source: Then, they use their Azure AD account (organizational identity) to register the device in Azure AD and enroll it with the company’s MDM solution.
segment.target: Then, they use their Azure AD account (organizational identity) to register the device in Azure AD and enroll it with the company’s MDM solution.

segment.source: You can apply policies to help protect and contain corporate apps and data on the devices, designed to prevent intellectual property leaks, but users keep full control over personal activities, such as downloading and installing apps and games.
segment.target: You can apply policies to help protect and contain corporate apps and data on the devices, designed to prevent intellectual property leaks, but users keep full control over personal activities, such as downloading and installing apps and games.

segment.source: Organizational identity.
segment.target: Organizational identity.

segment.source: In this scenario, employees use their Azure AD account to register the device to Azure AD and automatically enroll it with the organization’s MDM solution.
segment.target: In this scenario, employees use their Azure AD account to register the device to Azure AD and automatically enroll it with the organization’s MDM solution.

segment.source: In this case, companies can block personal use of devices.
segment.target: In this case, companies can block personal use of devices.

segment.source: Using organizational Identities to initialize devices gives organizations complete control over devices and allows them to prevent personalization.
segment.target: Using organizational Identities to initialize devices gives organizations complete control over devices and allows them to prevent personalization.

segment.source: Table 2.
segment.target: Table 2.

segment.source: Device sign-in

segment.source: Users cannot sign in to devices with Azure AD credentials, even if they add the credentials after initial activation with a Microsoft account.
segment.target: Users cannot sign in to devices with Azure AD credentials, even if they add the credentials after initial activation with a Microsoft account.

segment.source: Users can unlock devices with an Azure AD account.
segment.target: Users can unlock devices with an Azure AD account.

segment.source: Organizations can block the addition of a personal identity.
segment.target: Organizations can block the addition of a personal identity.

segment.source: User settings and data roaming across devices
segment.target: User settings and data roaming across devices

segment.source: User and app settings roam across devices activated with the same personal identity over personal OneDrive.
segment.target: User and app settings roam across devices activated with the same personal identity over personal OneDrive.

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile currently does not support users and app settings roaming over the enterprise cloud.
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile currently does not support users and app settings roaming over the enterprise cloud.

segment.source: It can block the roaming of personal cloud settings.
segment.target: It can block the roaming of personal cloud settings.

segment.source: Ability to block the use of a personal identity on the device
segment.target: Ability to block the use of a personal identity on the device

segment.source: No
segment.target: No

segment.source: Yes
segment.target: Yes

segment.source: Level of control
segment.target: Level of control

segment.source: Organization can apply most* restrictive policies to devices, but they cannot remove the Microsoft account from them.
segment.target: Organization can apply most* restrictive policies to devices, but they cannot remove the Microsoft account from them.

segment.source: Device users can reclaim full control over their devices by un-enrolling them from the organization’s MDM solution.
segment.target: Device users can reclaim full control over their devices by un-enrolling them from the organization’s MDM solution.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: MDM functionality on personal devices might be limited in the future.
segment.target: MDM functionality on personal devices might be limited in the future.

segment.source: Organizations are free to apply the restrictive policies to devices that policy standards and compliance regulations require and prevent the user from un-enrolling the device from the enterprise.
segment.target: Organizations are free to apply the restrictive policies to devices that policy standards and compliance regulations require and prevent the user from un-enrolling the device from the enterprise.

segment.source: Infrastructure requirements
segment.target: Infrastructure requirements

segment.source: For both device scenarios, the essential infrastructure and tools required to deploy and manage Windows 10 Mobile devices include an Azure AD subscription and an MDM system.
segment.target: For both device scenarios, the essential infrastructure and tools required to deploy and manage Windows 10 Mobile devices include an Azure AD subscription and an MDM system.

segment.source: Azure AD is a cloud-based directory service that provides identity and access management.
segment.target: Azure AD is a cloud-based directory service that provides identity and access management.

segment.source: You can integrate it with existing on-premises directories to create a hybrid solution.
segment.target: You can integrate it with existing on-premises directories to create a hybrid solution.

segment.source: Azure AD has three editions: Free, Basic, and Premium (see Azure Active Directory editions).
segment.target: Azure AD has three editions: Free, Basic, and Premium (see Azure Active Directory editions).

segment.source: All editions support Azure AD device registration, but the Premium edition is required to enable MDM auto-enrollment and conditional access based on device state.
segment.target: All editions support Azure AD device registration, but the Premium edition is required to enable MDM auto-enrollment and conditional access based on device state.

segment.source: Organizations that use Microsoft Office 365 or Intune are already using Azure AD.
segment.target: Organizations that use Microsoft Office 365 or Intune are already using Azure AD.

segment.source: Note: Most industry-leading MDM vendors already support integration with Azure AD or are working on integration.
segment.target: Note: Most industry-leading MDM vendors already support integration with Azure AD or are working on integration.

segment.source: You can find the MDM vendors that support Azure AD in Azure Marketplace.
segment.target: You can find the MDM vendors that support Azure AD in Azure Marketplace.

segment.source: Users can enroll Windows 10 Mobile devices in third-party MDM systems without using an Azure AD organizational account.
segment.target: Users can enroll Windows 10 Mobile devices in third-party MDM systems without using an Azure AD organizational account.

segment.source: (By default, Intune uses Azure AD and includes a license).
segment.target: (By default, Intune uses Azure AD and includes a license).

segment.source: If your organization doesn’t use Azure AD, you must use a personal identity to activate devices and enable common scenarios, such as downloading apps from Windows Store.
segment.target: If your organization doesn’t use Azure AD, you must use a personal identity to activate devices and enable common scenarios, such as downloading apps from Windows Store.

segment.source: Multiple MDM systems that support Windows 10 Mobile are available.
segment.target: Multiple MDM systems that support Windows 10 Mobile are available.

segment.source: Most support personal and corporate device deployment scenarios.
segment.target: Most support personal and corporate device deployment scenarios.

segment.source: Microsoft offers Intune, which is part of the Enterprise Mobility Suite and a cloud-based MDM system that manages devices off premises.
segment.target: Microsoft offers Intune, which is part of the Enterprise Mobility Suite and a cloud-based MDM system that manages devices off premises.

segment.source: Like Office 365, Intune uses Azure AD for identity management, so employees use the same credentials to enroll devices in Intune or sign in to Office 365.
segment.target: Like Office 365, Intune uses Azure AD for identity management, so employees use the same credentials to enroll devices in Intune or sign in to Office 365.

segment.source: Intune supports devices that run other operating systems, as well, such as iOS and Android, to provide a complete MDM solution.
segment.target: Intune supports devices that run other operating systems, as well, such as iOS and Android, to provide a complete MDM solution.

segment.source: You can also integrate Intune with System Center Configuration Manager to gain a single console in which to manage all devices—in the cloud and on premises.
segment.target: You can also integrate Intune with System Center Configuration Manager to gain a single console in which to manage all devices—in the cloud and on premises.

segment.source: For more information, see Manage Mobile Devices with Configuration Manager and Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For more information, see Manage Mobile Devices with Configuration Manager and Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: For guidance on choosing between a stand-alone Intune installation and Intune integrated with Configuration Manager, see Choose between Intune by itself or integrating Intune with System Center Configuration Manager.
segment.target: For guidance on choosing between a stand-alone Intune installation and Intune integrated with Configuration Manager, see Choose between Intune by itself or integrating Intune with System Center Configuration Manager.

segment.source: In addition to Intune, other MDM providers support Windows 10 Mobile.
segment.target: In addition to Intune, other MDM providers support Windows 10 Mobile.

segment.source: Currently, the following MDM systems claim to support Windows 10 and Windows 10 Mobile: AirWatch, Citrix, Lightspeed Systems, Matrix42, MobileIron, SAP, SOTI, and Symantec.
segment.target: Currently, the following MDM systems claim to support Windows 10 and Windows 10 Mobile: AirWatch, Citrix, Lightspeed Systems, Matrix42, MobileIron, SAP, SOTI, and Symantec.

segment.source: All MDM vendors have equal access to the Windows 10 MDM APIs.
segment.target: All MDM vendors have equal access to the Windows 10 MDM APIs.

segment.source: The extent to which they implement these APIs depends on the vendor.
segment.target: The extent to which they implement these APIs depends on the vendor.

segment.source: Contact your preferred MDM vendor to determine its level of support.
segment.target: Contact your preferred MDM vendor to determine its level of support.

segment.source: Note: Although not covered in this guide, you can use Exchange ActiveSync (EAS) to manage mobile devices instead of using a full-featured MDM system.
segment.target: Note: Although not covered in this guide, you can use Exchange ActiveSync (EAS) to manage mobile devices instead of using a full-featured MDM system.

segment.source: EAS is available in Microsoft Exchange Server 2010 or later and Office 365.
segment.target: EAS is available in Microsoft Exchange Server 2010 or later and Office 365.

segment.source: In addition, Microsoft recently added MDM capabilities powered by Intune to Office 365.
segment.target: In addition, Microsoft recently added MDM capabilities powered by Intune to Office 365.

segment.source: MDM for Office 365 supports mobile devices only, such as those running Windows 10 Mobile, iOS, and Android.
segment.target: MDM for Office 365 supports mobile devices only, such as those running Windows 10 Mobile, iOS, and Android.

segment.source: MDM for Office 365 offers a subset of the management capabilities found in Intune, including the ability to remotely wipe a device, block a device from accessing Exchange Server email, and configure device policies (for example, passcode requirements).
segment.target: MDM for Office 365 offers a subset of the management capabilities found in Intune, including the ability to remotely wipe a device, block a device from accessing Exchange Server email, and configure device policies (for example, passcode requirements).

segment.source: For more information about MDM for Office 365 capabilities, see Overview of Mobile Device Management for Office 365.
segment.target: For more information about MDM for Office 365 capabilities, see Overview of Mobile Device Management for Office 365.

segment.source: Provisioning
segment.target: Provisioning

segment.source: Provisioning is new to Windows 10 and uses the MDM client in Windows 10 Mobile.
segment.target: Provisioning is new to Windows 10 and uses the MDM client in Windows 10 Mobile.

segment.source: You can create a runtime provisioning package to apply settings, profiles, and file assets to a device running Windows 10.
segment.target: You can create a runtime provisioning package to apply settings, profiles, and file assets to a device running Windows 10.

segment.source: To assist users with MDM system enrollment, use a provisioning package.
segment.target: To assist users with MDM system enrollment, use a provisioning package.

segment.source: To do so, use the Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer to create a provisioning package, and then install that package on the device.
segment.target: To do so, use the Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer to create a provisioning package, and then install that package on the device.

segment.source: Users can perform self-service MDM enrollment based on the following deployment scenarios:
segment.target: Users can perform self-service MDM enrollment based on the following deployment scenarios:

segment.source: Corporate device.
segment.target: Corporate device.

segment.source: During the out-of-the-box experience (OOBE), you can instruct the user to select This device is owned by my organization and join the device to Azure AD and the MDM system.
segment.target: During the out-of-the-box experience (OOBE), you can instruct the user to select This device is owned by my organization and join the device to Azure AD and the MDM system.

segment.source: Personal device.
segment.target: Personal device.

segment.source: The user activates the device with a Microsoft account, but you can instruct him or her to register the device with Azure AD and enroll in Intune.
segment.target: The user activates the device with a Microsoft account, but you can instruct him or her to register the device with Azure AD and enroll in Intune.

segment.source: To do so in Windows 10 Mobile, the user clicks, Settings, clicks Accounts, and then clicks Work access.
segment.target: To do so in Windows 10 Mobile, the user clicks, Settings, clicks Accounts, and then clicks Work access.

segment.source: To automate MDM enrollment, use provisioning packages as follows:
segment.target: To automate MDM enrollment, use provisioning packages as follows:

segment.source: Corporate device.
segment.target: Corporate device.

segment.source: You can create a provisioning package and apply it to a corporate device before delivery to the user, or instruct the user to apply the package during OOBE.
segment.target: You can create a provisioning package and apply it to a corporate device before delivery to the user, or instruct the user to apply the package during OOBE.

segment.source: After application of the provisioning package, the OOBE process automatically chooses the enterprise path and requires the user to register the device with Azure AD and enroll it in the MDM system.
segment.target: After application of the provisioning package, the OOBE process automatically chooses the enterprise path and requires the user to register the device with Azure AD and enroll it in the MDM system.

segment.source: Personal device.
segment.target: Personal device.

segment.source: You can create a provisioning package and make it available to users who want to enroll their personal device in the enterprise.
segment.target: You can create a provisioning package and make it available to users who want to enroll their personal device in the enterprise.

segment.source: The user enrolls the device in the corporate MDM for further configuration by applying the provisioning package.
segment.target: The user enrolls the device in the corporate MDM for further configuration by applying the provisioning package.

segment.source: To do so in Windows 10 Mobile, the user clicks Settings, clicks Accounts, and then clicks Provisioning).
segment.target: To do so in Windows 10 Mobile, the user clicks Settings, clicks Accounts, and then clicks Provisioning).

segment.source: Distribute provisioning packages to devices by publishing them in an easily accessible location (e.g., an email attachment or a web page).
segment.target: Distribute provisioning packages to devices by publishing them in an easily accessible location (e.g., an email attachment or a web page).

segment.source: You can cryptographically sign or encrypt provisioning packages and require that the user enter a password to apply them.
segment.target: You can cryptographically sign or encrypt provisioning packages and require that the user enter a password to apply them.

segment.source: See Build and apply a provisioning package for more information on creating provisioning packages.
segment.target: See Build and apply a provisioning package for more information on creating provisioning packages.

segment.target: Define email account profiles in the MDM system, and then deploy them to devices.

segment.source: Account restrictions
segment.target: Account restrictions

segment.source: On a corporate device registered with Azure AD and enrolled in the MDM system, you can control whether users can use a Microsoft account or add other consumer email accounts.
segment.target: On a corporate device registered with Azure AD and enrolled in the MDM system, you can control whether users can use a Microsoft account or add other consumer email accounts.

segment.source: Table 5 lists the settings that you can use to manage accounts on Windows 10 Mobile devices.
segment.target: Table 5 lists the settings that you can use to manage accounts on Windows 10 Mobile devices.

segment.source: Table 5.
segment.target: Table 5.

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile account management settings
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile account management settings

segment.source: Setting
segment.target: Setting

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Allow Microsoft Account
segment.target: Allow Microsoft Account

segment.source: Specifies whether users are allowed to add a Microsoft account to the device after MDM enrollment and use this account for connection authentication and services, such as purchasing apps in Windows Store, or cloud-based consumer services, such as Xbox or Groove.
segment.target: Specifies whether users are allowed to add a Microsoft account to the device after MDM enrollment and use this account for connection authentication and services, such as purchasing apps in Windows Store, or cloud-based consumer services, such as Xbox or Groove.

segment.source: If a device was activated with a Microsoft account, the MDM system would not be able to block that account from being used.
segment.target: If a device was activated with a Microsoft account, the MDM system would not be able to block that account from being used.

segment.source: Allow Adding Non Microsoft Accounts
segment.target: Allow Adding Non Microsoft Accounts

segment.source: Specifies whether users are allowed to add email accounts other than Microsoft accounts after MDM enrollment.
segment.target: Specifies whether users are allowed to add email accounts other than Microsoft accounts after MDM enrollment.

segment.source: If Allow Microsoft Account is applied, user can also not use a Microsoft account.
segment.target: If Allow Microsoft Account is applied, user can also not use a Microsoft account.

segment.source: Allow “Your Account”
segment.target: Allow “Your Account”

segment.source: Specifies whether users are able to change account configuration in the Your Email and Accounts panel in Settings.
segment.target: Specifies whether users are able to change account configuration in the Your Email and Accounts panel in Settings.

segment.source: Device lock restrictions
segment.target: Device lock restrictions

segment.source: It’s common sense to lock a device when it is not in use.
segment.target: It’s common sense to lock a device when it is not in use.

segment.source: Microsoft recommends that you secure Windows 10 Mobile devices and implement a device lock policy.
segment.target: Microsoft recommends that you secure Windows 10 Mobile devices and implement a device lock policy.

segment.source: A device password or PIN lock is a best practice for securing apps and data on devices.
segment.target: A device password or PIN lock is a best practice for securing apps and data on devices.

segment.source: Windows Hello is the name given to the new biometric sign-in option that allows users to use their face, iris, or fingerprints to unlock their compatible device, all of which Windows 10 supports.
segment.target: Windows Hello is the name given to the new biometric sign-in option that allows users to use their face, iris, or fingerprints to unlock their compatible device, all of which Windows 10 supports.

segment.source: Note: In addition to the device lock restrictions discussed in this section, Windows 10 supports Microsoft Passport for Work, which lets you access apps and services without a password.
segment.target: Note: In addition to the device lock restrictions discussed in this section, Windows 10 supports Microsoft Passport for Work, which lets you access apps and services without a password.

segment.source: Table 6 lists the MDM settings in Windows 10 Mobile that you can use to configure device lock restrictions.
segment.target: Table 6 lists the MDM settings in Windows 10 Mobile that you can use to configure device lock restrictions.

segment.source: Table 6.
segment.target: Table 6.

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile device lock restrictions
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile device lock restrictions

segment.source: Setting
segment.target: Setting

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Device Password Enabled
segment.target: Device Password Enabled

segment.source: Specifies whether users are required to use a device lock password
segment.target: Specifies whether users are required to use a device lock password

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: When a device is registered with Azure AD and automatic MDM enrollment is not configured, the user will automatically be prompted to set a password PIN of at least six digits (simple PINs are not allowed).
segment.target: When a device is registered with Azure AD and automatic MDM enrollment is not configured, the user will automatically be prompted to set a password PIN of at least six digits (simple PINs are not allowed).

segment.source: If the device is capable of using biometric authentication, the user will be able to enroll an iris or other biometric gesture (depending on hardware) for device lock purposes.
segment.target: If the device is capable of using biometric authentication, the user will be able to enroll an iris or other biometric gesture (depending on hardware) for device lock purposes.

segment.source: When a user uses a biometric gesture, he or she can still use the PIN as a fallback mechanism (for example, if the iris-recognition camera fails).
segment.target: When a user uses a biometric gesture, he or she can still use the PIN as a fallback mechanism (for example, if the iris-recognition camera fails).

segment.source: Allow Simple Device Password
segment.target: Allow Simple Device Password

segment.source: Whether users can use a simple password (for example, 1111 or 1234)
segment.target: Whether users can use a simple password (for example, 1111 or 1234)

segment.source: Alphanumeric Device Password Required
segment.target: Alphanumeric Device Password Required

segment.source: Whether users need to use an alphanumeric password When configured, Windows prompts the user with a full device keyboard to enter a complex password.
segment.target: Whether users need to use an alphanumeric password When configured, Windows prompts the user with a full device keyboard to enter a complex password.

segment.source: When not configured, the user will be able to enter a numeric PIN on the keyboard.
segment.target: When not configured, the user will be able to enter a numeric PIN on the keyboard.

segment.source: Min Device Password Complex Characters
segment.target: Min Device Password Complex Characters

segment.source: The number of password element types (in other words, uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numbers, or punctuation) required to create strong passwords
segment.target: The number of password element types (in other words, uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numbers, or punctuation) required to create strong passwords

segment.source: Device Password Expiration
segment.target: Device Password Expiration

segment.source: The number of days before a password expires (Biometric data does not expire.)
segment.target: The number of days before a password expires (Biometric data does not expire.)

segment.source: Device Password History
segment.target: Device Password History

segment.source: The number of passwords Windows 10 Mobile remembers in the password history (Users cannot reuse passwords in the history to create new passwords.)
segment.target: The number of passwords Windows 10 Mobile remembers in the password history (Users cannot reuse passwords in the history to create new passwords.)

segment.source: Min Device Password Length
segment.target: Min Device Password Length

segment.source: The minimum number of characters required to create new passwords
segment.target: The minimum number of characters required to create new passwords

segment.source: Max Inactivity Time Device Lock
segment.target: Max Inactivity Time Device Lock

segment.source: The number of minutes of inactivity before devices are locked and require a password to unlock
segment.target: The number of minutes of inactivity before devices are locked and require a password to unlock

segment.source: Allow Idle Return Without Password
segment.target: Allow Idle Return Without Password

segment.source: Whether users are required to re-authenticate when their devices return from a sleep state, before the inactivity time was reached
segment.target: Whether users are required to re-authenticate when their devices return from a sleep state, before the inactivity time was reached

segment.source: Max Device Password Failed Attempts
segment.target: Max Device Password Failed Attempts

segment.source: The number of authentication failures allowed before a device is wiped (A value of zero disables device wipe functionality.)
segment.target: The number of authentication failures allowed before a device is wiped (A value of zero disables device wipe functionality.)

segment.source: Screen Timeout While Locked
segment.target: Screen Timeout While Locked

segment.source: The number of minutes before the lock screen times out (This policy influences the device’s power management.)
segment.target: The number of minutes before the lock screen times out (This policy influences the device’s power management.)

segment.source: Allow Screen Timeout While Locked User Configuration
segment.target: Allow Screen Timeout While Locked User Configuration

segment.source: Whether users can manually configure screen timeout while the device is on the lock screen (Windows 10 Mobile ignores the Screen Timeout While Locked setting if you disable this setting.)
segment.target: Whether users can manually configure screen timeout while the device is on the lock screen (Windows 10 Mobile ignores the Screen Timeout While Locked setting if you disable this setting.)

segment.source: Hardware restrictions
segment.target: Hardware restrictions

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile devices use state-of-the-art technology that includes popular hardware features such as cameras, global positioning system (GPS) sensors, microphones, speakers, near-field communication (NFC) radios, storage card slots, USB interfaces, Bluetooth interfaces, cellular radios, and Wi-Fi.
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile devices use state-of-the-art technology that includes popular hardware features such as cameras, global positioning system (GPS) sensors, microphones, speakers, near-field communication (NFC) radios, storage card slots, USB interfaces, Bluetooth interfaces, cellular radios, and Wi-Fi.

segment.source: You can also use hardware restrictions to control the availability of these features.
segment.target: You can also use hardware restrictions to control the availability of these features.

segment.source: Table 7 lists the MDM settings that Windows 10 Mobile supports to configure hardware restrictions.
segment.target: Table 7 lists the MDM settings that Windows 10 Mobile supports to configure hardware restrictions.

segment.source: Note: Some of these hardware restrictions provide connectivity and assist in data protection.
segment.target: Note: Some of these hardware restrictions provide connectivity and assist in data protection.

segment.target: Enterprise data protection is currently being tested in select customer evaluation programs.

segment.source: Certificate management
segment.target: Certificate management

segment.source: Managing certificates can be difficult for users, but certificates are pervasive for a variety of uses, including, account authentication, Wi-Fi authentication, VPN encryption, and SSL encryption of web content.
segment.target: Managing certificates can be difficult for users, but certificates are pervasive for a variety of uses, including, account authentication, Wi-Fi authentication, VPN encryption, and SSL encryption of web content.

segment.source: Although users could manage certificates on devices manually, it’s a best practice to use your MDM system to manage those certificates for their entire life cycle, from enrollment through renewal to revocation.
segment.target: Although users could manage certificates on devices manually, it’s a best practice to use your MDM system to manage those certificates for their entire life cycle, from enrollment through renewal to revocation.

segment.source: You can use the Simple Certificate Enrollment Protocol (SCEP) and Personal Information Exchange (PFX) certificates files to install certificates on Windows 10 Mobile.
segment.target: You can use the Simple Certificate Enrollment Protocol (SCEP) and Personal Information Exchange (PFX) certificates files to install certificates on Windows 10 Mobile.

segment.source: Certificate management through SCEP and MDM systems is fully transparent to users and requires no user intervention, so it helps improve user productivity and reduce support calls.
segment.target: Certificate management through SCEP and MDM systems is fully transparent to users and requires no user intervention, so it helps improve user productivity and reduce support calls.

segment.source: Your MDM system can automatically deploy these certificates to the devices’ certificate stores after you enroll the device.
segment.target: Your MDM system can automatically deploy these certificates to the devices’ certificate stores after you enroll the device.

segment.source: Apps running on Windows 10 Mobile (for example, Microsoft Edge) can use proxy connections to access Internet content, but Wi-Fi connections on the corporate intranet most typically use proxy connections, instead.
segment.target: Apps running on Windows 10 Mobile (for example, Microsoft Edge) can use proxy connections to access Internet content, but Wi-Fi connections on the corporate intranet most typically use proxy connections, instead.

segment.source: You can define multiple proxies in Windows 10 Mobile.
segment.target: You can define multiple proxies in Windows 10 Mobile.

segment.source: Note: Windows 10 Mobile also supports proxy auto-configuration (PAC) files, which can automatically configure proxy settings.
segment.target: Note: Windows 10 Mobile also supports proxy auto-configuration (PAC) files, which can automatically configure proxy settings.

segment.source: The Web Proxy Auto-Discovery Protocol (WPAD) lets apps use Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol and Domain Name System (DNS) lookups to locate the PAC file.
segment.target: The Web Proxy Auto-Discovery Protocol (WPAD) lets apps use Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol and Domain Name System (DNS) lookups to locate the PAC file.

segment.source: VPN
segment.target: VPN

segment.source: In addition to Wi-Fi, users often use a VPN to securely access apps and resources on their company’s intranet behind a firewall.
segment.target: In addition to Wi-Fi, users often use a VPN to securely access apps and resources on their company’s intranet behind a firewall.

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile supports several VPN vendors in addition to native Microsoft VPNs (such as Point to Point Tunneling Protocol PPTP, Layer 2 Tunneling Protocol \
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile supports several VPN vendors in addition to native Microsoft VPNs (such as Point to Point Tunneling Protocol PPTP, Layer 2 Tunneling Protocol \

segment.source: [L2TP, and Internet Key Exchange Protocol version 2 IKEv2), including:
segment.target: [L2TP, and Internet Key Exchange Protocol version 2 IKEv2), including:

segment.source: IKEv2
segment.target: IKEv2

segment.source: IP security
segment.target: IP security

segment.source: SSL VPN connections (which require a downloadable plug-in from the VPN server vendor)
segment.target: SSL VPN connections (which require a downloadable plug-in from the VPN server vendor)

segment.source: You can configure Windows 10 Mobile to use auto-triggered VPN connections, as well.
segment.target: You can configure Windows 10 Mobile to use auto-triggered VPN connections, as well.

segment.source: You define a VPN connection for each app that requires intranet connectivity.
segment.target: You define a VPN connection for each app that requires intranet connectivity.

segment.source: When users switch between apps, the operating system automatically establishes the VPN connection for that app.
segment.target: When users switch between apps, the operating system automatically establishes the VPN connection for that app.

segment.source: In the event the device drops the VPN connection, Windows 10 Mobile automatically reconnects to the VPN without user intervention.
segment.target: In the event the device drops the VPN connection, Windows 10 Mobile automatically reconnects to the VPN without user intervention.

segment.source: With always-on VPN, Windows 10 Mobile can automatically start a VPN connection when a user signs-in, as well.
segment.target: With always-on VPN, Windows 10 Mobile can automatically start a VPN connection when a user signs-in, as well.

segment.source: The VPN stays connected until the user manually disconnects it.
segment.target: The VPN stays connected until the user manually disconnects it.

segment.source: MDM support for VPN connections in Windows 10 Mobile includes provisioning and updating VPN connection profiles and associating VPN connections with apps.
segment.target: MDM support for VPN connections in Windows 10 Mobile includes provisioning and updating VPN connection profiles and associating VPN connections with apps.

segment.source: You can create and provision VPN connection profiles, and then deploy them to managed devices that run Windows 10 Mobile.
segment.target: You can create and provision VPN connection profiles, and then deploy them to managed devices that run Windows 10 Mobile.

segment.source: APN profiles
segment.target: APN profiles

segment.source: An APN defines network paths for cellular data connectivity.
segment.target: An APN defines network paths for cellular data connectivity.

segment.source: Typically, you define just one APN for a device in collaboration with a mobile operator, but you can define multiple APNs if your company uses multiple mobile operators.
segment.target: Typically, you define just one APN for a device in collaboration with a mobile operator, but you can define multiple APNs if your company uses multiple mobile operators.

segment.source: An APN provides a private connection to the corporate network that is unavailable to other companies on the mobile operator network.
segment.target: An APN provides a private connection to the corporate network that is unavailable to other companies on the mobile operator network.

segment.source: Corporations in Europe and the Asia-Pacific use APNs, but they are not common in the United States.
segment.target: Corporations in Europe and the Asia-Pacific use APNs, but they are not common in the United States.

segment.source: You can define and deploy APN profiles in MDM systems that configure cellular data connectivity for Windows 10 Mobile.
segment.target: You can define and deploy APN profiles in MDM systems that configure cellular data connectivity for Windows 10 Mobile.

segment.source: Devices running Windows 10 Mobile can have only one APN profile.
segment.target: Devices running Windows 10 Mobile can have only one APN profile.

segment.source: Data leak protection
segment.target: Data leak protection

segment.source: Some user experiences can risk corporate data stored on corporate devices.
segment.target: Some user experiences can risk corporate data stored on corporate devices.

segment.source: For example, allowing users to copy and paste information out of the organization’s LOB app can put data at risk.
segment.target: For example, allowing users to copy and paste information out of the organization’s LOB app can put data at risk.

segment.source: To mitigate the risk, you can restrict the Windows 10 Mobile user experience to help protect corporate data and prevent data leaks.
segment.target: To mitigate the risk, you can restrict the Windows 10 Mobile user experience to help protect corporate data and prevent data leaks.

segment.source: For example, you can prevent settings synchronization, copy-and-paste operations, and screen captures.
segment.target: For example, you can prevent settings synchronization, copy-and-paste operations, and screen captures.

segment.source: Storage management
segment.target: Storage management

segment.source: Protecting the apps and data stored on a device is critical to device security.
segment.target: Protecting the apps and data stored on a device is critical to device security.

segment.source: One method for helping protect your apps and data is to encrypt internal device storage by using the device encryption in Windows 10 Mobile.
segment.target: One method for helping protect your apps and data is to encrypt internal device storage by using the device encryption in Windows 10 Mobile.

segment.source: This encryption helps protect corporate data against unauthorized access, even when an unauthorized user has physical possession of the device.
segment.target: This encryption helps protect corporate data against unauthorized access, even when an unauthorized user has physical possession of the device.

segment.source: A feature in Windows 10 Mobile is the ability to install apps on a secure digital (SD) card.
segment.target: A feature in Windows 10 Mobile is the ability to install apps on a secure digital (SD) card.

segment.source: The operating system stores apps on a partition specifically designated for that purpose.
segment.target: The operating system stores apps on a partition specifically designated for that purpose.

segment.source: This feature is always on, so you don’t need to set a policy explicitly to enable it.
segment.target: This feature is always on, so you don’t need to set a policy explicitly to enable it.

segment.source: The SD card is uniquely paired with a device.
segment.target: The SD card is uniquely paired with a device.

segment.source: No other devices can see the apps or data on the encrypted partition, but they can access the data stored on the unencrypted partition of the SD card, such as music or photos.
segment.target: No other devices can see the apps or data on the encrypted partition, but they can access the data stored on the unencrypted partition of the SD card, such as music or photos.

segment.source: You can disable the Allow Storage Card setting to prevent users from using SD cards altogether, but the primary advantage of the SD card app partition–encryption feature is that organizations can give users the flexibility to use an SD card while still protecting the confidential apps and data on it.
segment.target: You can disable the Allow Storage Card setting to prevent users from using SD cards altogether, but the primary advantage of the SD card app partition–encryption feature is that organizations can give users the flexibility to use an SD card while still protecting the confidential apps and data on it.

segment.source: If you don’t encrypt storage, you can help protect your corporate apps and data by using the Restrict app data to the system volume and Restrict apps to the system volume settings.
segment.target: If you don’t encrypt storage, you can help protect your corporate apps and data by using the Restrict app data to the system volume and Restrict apps to the system volume settings.

segment.source: They help ensure that users cannot copy your apps and data to SD cards.
segment.target: They help ensure that users cannot copy your apps and data to SD cards.

segment.source: App management
segment.target: App management

segment.source: Apps help improve user productivity on mobile devices.
segment.target: Apps help improve user productivity on mobile devices.

segment.source: New to Windows 10 is the ability for organizations purchase apps from Windows Store for their employees and deploy those apps from Windows Store or an MDM system.
segment.target: New to Windows 10 is the ability for organizations purchase apps from Windows Store for their employees and deploy those apps from Windows Store or an MDM system.

segment.source: App management is becoming a key capability of MDM systems, helping reduce the effort required to perform common app-related tasks, such as distributing apps, and protecting data through app policies.
segment.target: App management is becoming a key capability of MDM systems, helping reduce the effort required to perform common app-related tasks, such as distributing apps, and protecting data through app policies.

segment.source: This section describes the app management features in Windows 10 Mobile and includes the following topics:
segment.target: This section describes the app management features in Windows 10 Mobile and includes the following topics:

segment.source: Universal Windows Platform (UWP)
segment.target: Universal Windows Platform (UWP)

segment.source: Sourcing the right app
segment.target: Sourcing the right app

segment.source: Windows Store for Business
segment.target: Windows Store for Business

segment.source: Mobile application management (MAM) policies
segment.target: Mobile application management (MAM) policies

segment.source: Microsoft Edge
segment.target: Microsoft Edge

segment.source: Universal Windows Platform
segment.target: Universal Windows Platform

segment.source: Windows 10 introduces UWP, converging the application platform for all devices running some edition of Windows 10.
segment.target: Windows 10 introduces UWP, converging the application platform for all devices running some edition of Windows 10.

segment.source: UWP apps run without modification on all editions of Windows 10, and Windows Store now has apps that you can license and purchased for all your Windows 10 devices.
segment.target: UWP apps run without modification on all editions of Windows 10, and Windows Store now has apps that you can license and purchased for all your Windows 10 devices.

segment.source: Windows Phone 8.1 and Windows 8.1 apps still run on Windows 10 devices, but the MAM improvements in Windows 10 work only with UWP apps.
segment.target: Windows Phone 8.1 and Windows 8.1 apps still run on Windows 10 devices, but the MAM improvements in Windows 10 work only with UWP apps.

segment.source: See the Guide to Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps for additional information.
segment.target: See the Guide to Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps for additional information.

segment.source: Sourcing the right app
segment.target: Sourcing the right app

segment.source: The first step in app management is to obtain the apps your users need, and you can now acquire apps from Windows Store.
segment.target: The first step in app management is to obtain the apps your users need, and you can now acquire apps from Windows Store.

segment.source: Developers can also create apps specific to an organization, known as line-of-business (LOB) apps (the developers of these apps are LOB publishers).
segment.target: Developers can also create apps specific to an organization, known as line-of-business (LOB) apps (the developers of these apps are LOB publishers).

segment.source: An LOB developer (internal or external) can now publish these apps to Windows Store at your request, or you can obtain the app packages offline and distribute them through your MDM system.
segment.target: An LOB developer (internal or external) can now publish these apps to Windows Store at your request, or you can obtain the app packages offline and distribute them through your MDM system.

segment.source: To install Windows Store or LOB apps, use the Windows Store cloud service or your MDM system to distribute the app packages.
segment.target: To install Windows Store or LOB apps, use the Windows Store cloud service or your MDM system to distribute the app packages.

segment.source: Your MDM system can deploy apps online by redirecting the user to a licensed app in Windows Store or offline by distributing a package that you downloaded from Windows Store (also called sideloading) on Windows 10 Mobile devices.
segment.target: Your MDM system can deploy apps online by redirecting the user to a licensed app in Windows Store or offline by distributing a package that you downloaded from Windows Store (also called sideloading) on Windows 10 Mobile devices.

segment.source: You can fully automate the app deployment process so that no user intervention is required.
segment.target: You can fully automate the app deployment process so that no user intervention is required.

segment.source: IT administrators can obtain apps through Store for Business.
segment.target: IT administrators can obtain apps through Store for Business.

segment.source: Most apps can be distributed online, meaning that the user must be logged in to the device with an Azure AD account and have Internet access at the time of installation.
segment.target: Most apps can be distributed online, meaning that the user must be logged in to the device with an Azure AD account and have Internet access at the time of installation.

segment.source: To distribute an app offline, the developer must opt in.
segment.target: To distribute an app offline, the developer must opt in.

segment.source: If the app developer doesn’t allow download of the app from Windows Store, then you must obtain the files directly from the developer or use the online method.
segment.target: If the app developer doesn’t allow download of the app from Windows Store, then you must obtain the files directly from the developer or use the online method.

segment.source: See Windows Store for Business for additional information about apps obtained through Store for Business.
segment.target: See Windows Store for Business for additional information about apps obtained through Store for Business.

segment.source: Windows Store apps are automatically trusted.
segment.target: Windows Store apps are automatically trusted.

segment.source: For custom LOB apps developed internally or by a trusted software vendor, ensure that the device trusts the app signing certificate.
segment.target: For custom LOB apps developed internally or by a trusted software vendor, ensure that the device trusts the app signing certificate.

segment.source: There are two ways to establish this trust: use a signing certificate from a trusted source, or generate your own signing certificate and add your chain of trust to the trusted certificates on the device.
segment.target: There are two ways to establish this trust: use a signing certificate from a trusted source, or generate your own signing certificate and add your chain of trust to the trusted certificates on the device.

segment.source: You can install up to 20 self-signed apps on a Windows 10 Mobile device.
segment.target: You can install up to 20 self-signed apps on a Windows 10 Mobile device.

segment.source: When you purchase a signing certificate from a public CA, you can install more than 20 apps on a device, although you can install more than 20 self-signed apps per device with Windows 10 Mobile Enterprise.
segment.target: When you purchase a signing certificate from a public CA, you can install more than 20 apps on a device, although you can install more than 20 self-signed apps per device with Windows 10 Mobile Enterprise.

segment.source: Users can install apps from Windows Store that the organization purchases through the Store app on their device.
segment.target: Users can install apps from Windows Store that the organization purchases through the Store app on their device.

segment.source: If you allow your users to log in with a Microsoft account, the Store app on the device provides a unified method for installing personal and corporate apps.
segment.target: If you allow your users to log in with a Microsoft account, the Store app on the device provides a unified method for installing personal and corporate apps.

segment.source: Store for Business
segment.target: Store for Business

segment.source: Windows Store for Business is a web portal that IT pros and purchasers use to find, acquire, manage, and distribute apps to Windows 10 devices.
segment.target: Windows Store for Business is a web portal that IT pros and purchasers use to find, acquire, manage, and distribute apps to Windows 10 devices.

segment.source: This online portal gives Azure AD authenticated managers access to Store for Business functionality and settings.
segment.target: This online portal gives Azure AD authenticated managers access to Store for Business functionality and settings.

segment.source: Store managers can create a private section of Windows Store in which organizations can manage apps specific and private to them.
segment.target: Store managers can create a private section of Windows Store in which organizations can manage apps specific and private to them.

segment.source: Store for Business allows organizations to make apps available to their users and purchase app licenses for them.
segment.target: Store for Business allows organizations to make apps available to their users and purchase app licenses for them.

segment.source: They can also integrate their Store for Business subscriptions with their MDM systems, so the MDM system can deploy apps from their free Store for Business subscription.
segment.target: They can also integrate their Store for Business subscriptions with their MDM systems, so the MDM system can deploy apps from their free Store for Business subscription.

segment.source: The process for using Store for Business is as follows:
segment.target: The process for using Store for Business is as follows:

segment.source: Create a Store for Business subscription for your organization.
segment.target: Create a Store for Business subscription for your organization.

segment.source: In the Store for Business portal, acquire apps from Windows Store (only free apps are available at this time).
segment.target: In the Store for Business portal, acquire apps from Windows Store (only free apps are available at this time).

segment.source: In Store for Business, distribute apps to users, and manage the app licenses for the apps acquired in the previous step.
segment.target: In Store for Business, distribute apps to users, and manage the app licenses for the apps acquired in the previous step.

segment.source: Integrate your MDM system with your organization’s Store for Business subscription.
segment.target: Integrate your MDM system with your organization’s Store for Business subscription.

segment.source: Use your MDM system to deploy the apps.
segment.target: Use your MDM system to deploy the apps.

segment.source: For more information about Store for Business, see Windows Store for Business.
segment.target: For more information about Store for Business, see Windows Store for Business.

segment.source: Mobile application management (MAM) policies
segment.target: Mobile application management (MAM) policies

segment.source: With MDM, you can manage Device Guard on Windows 10 Mobile and create an allow (whitelist) or deny (blacklist) list of apps.
segment.target: With MDM, you can manage Device Guard on Windows 10 Mobile and create an allow (whitelist) or deny (blacklist) list of apps.

segment.source: This capability extends to built-in apps, as well, such as phone, text messaging, email, and calendar.
segment.target: This capability extends to built-in apps, as well, such as phone, text messaging, email, and calendar.

segment.source: The ability to allow or deny apps helps to ensure that people use their mobile devices for their intended purposes.

segment.source: You can also control users’ access to Windows Store and whether the Store service updates apps automatically.
segment.target: You can also control users’ access to Windows Store and whether the Store service updates apps automatically.

segment.source: You can manage all these capabilities through your MDM system.
segment.target: You can manage all these capabilities through your MDM system.

segment.source: Device update
segment.target: Device update

segment.source: To help protect mobile devices and their data, you must keep those devices updated.
segment.target: To help protect mobile devices and their data, you must keep those devices updated.

segment.source: Windows Update automatically installs updates and upgrades when they become available.
segment.target: Windows Update automatically installs updates and upgrades when they become available.

segment.source: The device update features described in this section are available only in Windows 10 Mobile Enterprise.
segment.target: The device update features described in this section are available only in Windows 10 Mobile Enterprise.

segment.source: You can use your MDM system to postpone system upgrades when you activate an Enterprise license on managed Windows 10 Mobile devices and control how updates and upgrades are applied.
segment.target: You can use your MDM system to postpone system upgrades when you activate an Enterprise license on managed Windows 10 Mobile devices and control how updates and upgrades are applied.

segment.source: For example, you can disable updates altogether, defer updates and upgrades, and schedule the day and time to install updates, as you would with Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) on Windows 10 desktops running the Current Branch for Business.
segment.target: For example, you can disable updates altogether, defer updates and upgrades, and schedule the day and time to install updates, as you would with Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) on Windows 10 desktops running the Current Branch for Business.
