segment.source: Device compliance monitoring
segment.target: Device compliance monitoring

segment.source: You can use your MDM system to monitor compliance.
segment.target: You can use your MDM system to monitor compliance.

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile provides audit information to track issues or perform remedial actions.
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile provides audit information to track issues or perform remedial actions.

segment.source: This information helps you ensure that devices are configured to comply with organizational standards.
segment.target: This information helps you ensure that devices are configured to comply with organizational standards.

segment.source: You can also assess the health of devices that run Windows 10 Mobile and take enterprise policy actions.
segment.target: You can also assess the health of devices that run Windows 10 Mobile and take enterprise policy actions.

segment.source: The process that the health attestation feature in Windows 10 Mobile uses is as follows:
segment.target: The process that the health attestation feature in Windows 10 Mobile uses is as follows:

segment.source: The health attestation client collects data used to verify device health.
segment.target: The health attestation client collects data used to verify device health.

segment.source: The client forwards the data to the Health Attestation Service (HAS).
segment.target: The client forwards the data to the Health Attestation Service (HAS).

segment.source: The HAS generates a Health Attestation Certificate.
segment.target: The HAS generates a Health Attestation Certificate.

segment.source: The client forwards the Health Attestation Certificate and related information to the MDM system for verification.
segment.target: The client forwards the Health Attestation Certificate and related information to the MDM system for verification.

segment.source: For more information about health attestation in Windows 10 Mobile, see the Windows 10 Mobile security guide.
segment.target: For more information about health attestation in Windows 10 Mobile, see the Windows 10 Mobile security guide.

segment.source: Depending on the results of the health state validation, an MDM system can take one of the following actions:
segment.target: Depending on the results of the health state validation, an MDM system can take one of the following actions:

segment.source: Allow the device to access resources.
segment.target: Allow the device to access resources.

segment.source: Allow the device to access resources but identify the device for further investigation.
segment.target: Allow the device to access resources but identify the device for further investigation.

segment.source: Prevent the device from accessing resources.
segment.target: Prevent the device from accessing resources.

segment.source: Table 21 lists data points that the HAS collects and evaluates from devices that run Windows 10 Mobile to determine the action to perform.
segment.target: Table 21 lists data points that the HAS collects and evaluates from devices that run Windows 10 Mobile to determine the action to perform.

segment.source: For most of these data points, the MDM system can take one of the following actions:
segment.target: For most of these data points, the MDM system can take one of the following actions:

segment.source: Disallow all access.
segment.target: Disallow all access.

segment.source: Disallow access to high-business-impact assets.
segment.target: Disallow access to high-business-impact assets.

segment.source: Allow conditional access based on other data points that are present at evaluation time—for example, other attributes on the health certificate or a device’s past activities and trust history.
segment.target: Allow conditional access based on other data points that are present at evaluation time—for example, other attributes on the health certificate or a device’s past activities and trust history.

segment.source: Take one of the previous actions, and also place the device on a watch list to monitor it more closely for potential risks.
segment.target: Take one of the previous actions, and also place the device on a watch list to monitor it more closely for potential risks.

segment.source: Take corrective action, such as informing IT administrators to contact the owner and investigate the issue.
segment.target: Take corrective action, such as informing IT administrators to contact the owner and investigate the issue.

segment.source: Table 21.
segment.target: Table 21.

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile HAS data points
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile HAS data points

segment.source: Data point
segment.target: Data point

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Attestation Identity Key (AIK) present
segment.target: Attestation Identity Key (AIK) present

segment.source: Indicates that an AIK is present (in other words, the device can be trusted more than a device without an AIK).
segment.target: Indicates that an AIK is present (in other words, the device can be trusted more than a device without an AIK).

segment.source: Data Execution Prevention (DEP) enabled
segment.target: Data Execution Prevention (DEP) enabled

segment.source: Whether a DEP policy is enabled for the device, indicating that the device can be trusted more than a device without a DEP policy.
segment.target: Whether a DEP policy is enabled for the device, indicating that the device can be trusted more than a device without a DEP policy.

segment.source: BitLocker status
segment.target: BitLocker status

segment.source: BitLocker helps protect the storage on the device.
segment.target: BitLocker helps protect the storage on the device.

segment.source: A device with BitLocker can be trusted more than a device without BitLocker.
segment.target: A device with BitLocker can be trusted more than a device without BitLocker.

segment.source: Secure Boot enabled
segment.target: Secure Boot enabled

segment.source: Whether Secure Boot is enabled on the device.
segment.target: Whether Secure Boot is enabled on the device.

segment.source: A device with Secure Boot enabled can be trusted more than a device without Secure Boot.
segment.target: A device with Secure Boot enabled can be trusted more than a device without Secure Boot.

segment.source: Secure Boot is always enabled on Windows 10 Mobile devices.
segment.target: Secure Boot is always enabled on Windows 10 Mobile devices.

segment.source: Code integrity enabled
segment.target: Code integrity enabled

segment.source: Whether the code integrity of a drive or system file is validated each time it’s loaded into memory.
segment.target: Whether the code integrity of a drive or system file is validated each time it’s loaded into memory.

segment.source: A device with code integrity enabled can be trusted more than a device without code integrity.
segment.target: A device with code integrity enabled can be trusted more than a device without code integrity.

segment.source: Safe mode
segment.target: Safe mode

segment.source: Whether Windows is running in safe mode.
segment.target: Whether Windows is running in safe mode.

segment.source: A device that is running Windows in safe mode isn’t as trustworthy as a device running in standard mode.
segment.target: A device that is running Windows in safe mode isn’t as trustworthy as a device running in standard mode.

segment.source: Running Windows Preinstallation Environment (Windows PE)
segment.target: Running Windows Preinstallation Environment (Windows PE)

segment.source: Whether the device is running Windows PE.
segment.target: Whether the device is running Windows PE.

segment.source: A device running Windows PE isn’t as secure as a device running Windows 10 Mobile.
segment.target: A device running Windows PE isn’t as secure as a device running Windows 10 Mobile.

segment.source: Boot debug enabled
segment.target: Boot debug enabled

segment.source: Whether the device has boot debug enabled.
segment.target: Whether the device has boot debug enabled.

segment.source: A device that has boot debug enabled is less secure (trusted) than a device without boot debug enabled.
segment.target: A device that has boot debug enabled is less secure (trusted) than a device without boot debug enabled.

segment.source: OS kernel debugging enabled
segment.target: OS kernel debugging enabled

segment.source: Whether the device has operating system kernel debugging enabled.
segment.target: Whether the device has operating system kernel debugging enabled.

segment.source: A device that has operating system kernel debugging enabled is less secure (trusted) than a device with operating system kernel debugging disabled.
segment.target: A device that has operating system kernel debugging enabled is less secure (trusted) than a device with operating system kernel debugging disabled.

segment.source: Test signing enabled
segment.target: Test signing enabled

segment.source: Whether test signing is disabled.
segment.target: Whether test signing is disabled.

segment.source: A device that has test signing disabled is more trustworthy than a device that has test signing enabled.
segment.target: A device that has test signing disabled is more trustworthy than a device that has test signing enabled.

segment.source: Boot Manager Version
segment.target: Boot Manager Version

segment.source: The version of the Boot Manager running on the device.
segment.target: The version of the Boot Manager running on the device.

segment.source: The HAS can check this version to determine whether the most current Boot Manager is running, which is more secure (trusted).
segment.target: The HAS can check this version to determine whether the most current Boot Manager is running, which is more secure (trusted).

segment.source: Code integrity version
segment.target: Code integrity version

segment.source: Specifies the version of code that is performing integrity checks during the boot sequence.
segment.target: Specifies the version of code that is performing integrity checks during the boot sequence.

segment.source: The HAS can check this version to determine whether the most current version of code is running, which is more secure (trusted).
segment.target: The HAS can check this version to determine whether the most current version of code is running, which is more secure (trusted).

segment.source: Secure Boot Configuration Policy (SBCP) present
segment.target: Secure Boot Configuration Policy (SBCP) present

segment.source: Whether the hash of the custom SBCP is present.
segment.target: Whether the hash of the custom SBCP is present.

segment.source: A device with an SBCP hash present is more trustworthy than a device without an SBCP hash.
segment.target: A device with an SBCP hash present is more trustworthy than a device without an SBCP hash.

segment.source: Boot cycle whitelist
segment.target: Boot cycle whitelist

segment.source: The view of the host platform between boot cycles as defined by the manufacturer compared to a published whitelist.
segment.target: The view of the host platform between boot cycles as defined by the manufacturer compared to a published whitelist.

segment.source: A device that complies with the whitelist is more trustworthy (secure) than a device that is noncompliant.
segment.target: A device that complies with the whitelist is more trustworthy (secure) than a device that is noncompliant.

segment.source: Device inventory
segment.target: Device inventory

segment.source: Device inventory helps organizations better manage devices because it provides in-depth information about those devices.
segment.target: Device inventory helps organizations better manage devices because it provides in-depth information about those devices.

segment.source: MDM systems collect inventory information remotely, and you can use the system’s reporting capabilities to analyze device resources and information.
segment.target: MDM systems collect inventory information remotely, and you can use the system’s reporting capabilities to analyze device resources and information.

segment.source: With this information, you can determine the current hardware and software resources of the device (for example, installed updates).
segment.target: With this information, you can determine the current hardware and software resources of the device (for example, installed updates).

segment.target: Table 22 lists examples of the Windows 10 Mobile software and hardware information that a device inventory provides.

segment.source: In addition to this information, the MDM system can read any of the configuration settings described in this guide.
segment.target: In addition to this information, the MDM system can read any of the configuration settings described in this guide.

segment.source: Remote assistance
segment.target: Remote assistance

segment.source: The remote assistance features in Windows 10 Mobile help resolve issues that users might encounter even when the help desk does not have physical access to the device.
segment.target: The remote assistance features in Windows 10 Mobile help resolve issues that users might encounter even when the help desk does not have physical access to the device.

segment.source: These features include:
segment.target: These features include:

segment.source: Remote lock.
segment.target: Remote lock.

segment.source: Support personnel can remotely lock a device.
segment.target: Support personnel can remotely lock a device.

segment.source: This ability can help when a user loses his or her mobile device and can retrieve it but not immediately (for example, leaving the device at a customer site).
segment.target: This ability can help when a user loses his or her mobile device and can retrieve it but not immediately (for example, leaving the device at a customer site).

segment.source: Remote PIN reset.
segment.target: Remote PIN reset.

segment.source: Support personnel can remotely reset the PIN, which helps when users forget their PIN and are unable to access their device.
segment.target: Support personnel can remotely reset the PIN, which helps when users forget their PIN and are unable to access their device.

segment.source: No corporate or user data is lost, and users are able to gain access to their devices quickly.
segment.target: No corporate or user data is lost, and users are able to gain access to their devices quickly.

segment.source: Remote ring.
segment.target: Remote ring.

segment.source: Support personnel can remotely make devices ring.
segment.target: Support personnel can remotely make devices ring.

segment.source: This ability can help users locate misplaced devices and, in conjunction with the Remote Lock feature, help ensure that unauthorized users are unable to access the device if they find it.
segment.target: This ability can help users locate misplaced devices and, in conjunction with the Remote Lock feature, help ensure that unauthorized users are unable to access the device if they find it.

segment.source: Remote find.
segment.target: Remote find.

segment.source: Support personnel can remotely locate a device on a map, which helps identify the geographic location of the device.
segment.target: Support personnel can remotely locate a device on a map, which helps identify the geographic location of the device.

segment.source: To configure Windows 10 Mobile remote find, use the settings in Table 23.
segment.target: To configure Windows 10 Mobile remote find, use the settings in Table 23.

segment.source: The remote find feature returns the most current latitude, longitude, and altitude of the device.
segment.target: The remote find feature returns the most current latitude, longitude, and altitude of the device.

segment.source: These remote management features help organizations reduce the IT effort required to manage devices.
segment.target: These remote management features help organizations reduce the IT effort required to manage devices.

segment.source: They also help users quickly regain use of their device should they misplace it or forget the device password.
segment.target: They also help users quickly regain use of their device should they misplace it or forget the device password.

segment.source: Table 23.
segment.target: Table 23.

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile remote find settings
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile remote find settings

segment.source: Setting
segment.target: Setting

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Desired location accuracy
segment.target: Desired location accuracy

segment.source: The desired accuracy as a radius value in meters; has a value between 1 and 1,000 meters
segment.target: The desired accuracy as a radius value in meters; has a value between 1 and 1,000 meters

segment.source: Maximum remote find
segment.target: Maximum remote find

segment.source: Maximum length of time in minutes that the server will accept a successful remote find; has a value between 0 and 1,000 minutes
segment.target: Maximum length of time in minutes that the server will accept a successful remote find; has a value between 0 and 1,000 minutes

segment.source: Remote find timeout
segment.target: Remote find timeout

segment.source: The number of seconds devices should wait for a remote find to finish; has a value between 0 and 1,800 seconds
segment.target: The number of seconds devices should wait for a remote find to finish; has a value between 0 and 1,800 seconds

segment.source: Cloud services
segment.target: Cloud services

segment.source: On mobile devices that run Windows 10 Mobile, users can easily connect to apps and data.
segment.target: On mobile devices that run Windows 10 Mobile, users can easily connect to apps and data.

segment.source: As a result, they frequently connect to cloud services that provide user notifications and collect telemetry (usage data).
segment.target: As a result, they frequently connect to cloud services that provide user notifications and collect telemetry (usage data).

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile enables organizations to manage how devices consume these cloud services.
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile enables organizations to manage how devices consume these cloud services.

segment.source: Manage push notifications
segment.target: Manage push notifications

segment.source: The Windows Push Notification Services enable software developers to send toast, tile, badge, and raw updates from their cloud services.
segment.target: The Windows Push Notification Services enable software developers to send toast, tile, badge, and raw updates from their cloud services.

segment.source: It provides a mechanism to deliver updates to users in a power-efficient and dependable way.
segment.target: It provides a mechanism to deliver updates to users in a power-efficient and dependable way.

segment.source: Push notifications can affect battery life, however, so the battery saver in Windows 10 Mobile limits background activity on the devices to extend battery life.
segment.target: Push notifications can affect battery life, however, so the battery saver in Windows 10 Mobile limits background activity on the devices to extend battery life.

segment.source: Users can configure battery saver to turn on automatically when the battery drops below a set threshold.
segment.target: Users can configure battery saver to turn on automatically when the battery drops below a set threshold.

segment.source: When battery saver is on, Windows 10 Mobile disables the receipt of push notifications to save energy.
segment.target: When battery saver is on, Windows 10 Mobile disables the receipt of push notifications to save energy.

segment.source: There is an exception to this behavior, however.
segment.target: There is an exception to this behavior, however.

segment.source: In Windows 10 Mobile, the Always allowed battery saver settings (found in the Settings app) allow apps to receive push notifications even when battery saver is on.
segment.target: In Windows 10 Mobile, the Always allowed battery saver settings (found in the Settings app) allow apps to receive push notifications even when battery saver is on.

segment.source: Users can manually configure this list, or you can use the MDM system to configure it—that is, you can use the battery saver settings URI scheme in Windows 10 Mobile (ms-settings:batterysaver-settings) to configure these settings.
segment.target: Users can manually configure this list, or you can use the MDM system to configure it—that is, you can use the battery saver settings URI scheme in Windows 10 Mobile (ms-settings:batterysaver-settings) to configure these settings.

segment.source: For more information about push notifications, see Windows Push Notification Services (WNS) overview.
segment.target: For more information about push notifications, see Windows Push Notification Services (WNS) overview.

segment.source: Manage telemetry
segment.target: Manage telemetry

segment.source: As people use Windows 10 Mobile, it can collect performance and usage telemetry that helps Microsoft identify and troubleshoot problems as well as improve its products and services.
segment.target: As people use Windows 10 Mobile, it can collect performance and usage telemetry that helps Microsoft identify and troubleshoot problems as well as improve its products and services.

segment.source: Microsoft recommends that you select Full for this setting.
segment.target: Microsoft recommends that you select Full for this setting.

segment.source: Microsoft employees, contractors, vendors, and partners might have access to relevant portions of the information that Windows 10 Mobile collects, but they are permitted to use the information only to repair or improve Microsoft products and services or third-party software and hardware designed for use with Microsoft products and services.
segment.target: Microsoft employees, contractors, vendors, and partners might have access to relevant portions of the information that Windows 10 Mobile collects, but they are permitted to use the information only to repair or improve Microsoft products and services or third-party software and hardware designed for use with Microsoft products and services.

segment.source: You can control the level of data that MDM systems collect.
segment.target: You can control the level of data that MDM systems collect.

segment.source: Table 24 lists the data levels that Windows 10 Mobile collects and provides a brief description of each.
segment.target: Table 24 lists the data levels that Windows 10 Mobile collects and provides a brief description of each.

segment.source: To configure devices, specify one of these levels in the Allow Telemetry setting.
segment.target: To configure devices, specify one of these levels in the Allow Telemetry setting.

segment.source: Table 24.
segment.target: Table 24.

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile data collection levels
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile data collection levels

segment.source: Level of data
segment.target: Level of data

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Security
segment.target: Security

segment.source: Collects only the information required to keep Windows 10 Mobile enterprise-grade secure, including information about telemetry client settings, the Malicious Software Removal Tool, and Windows Defender.
segment.target: Collects only the information required to keep Windows 10 Mobile enterprise-grade secure, including information about telemetry client settings, the Malicious Software Removal Tool, and Windows Defender.

segment.source: This level is available only on Windows 10 Enterprise, Windows 10 Education, and Windows 10 IoT Core.
segment.target: This level is available only on Windows 10 Enterprise, Windows 10 Education, and Windows 10 IoT Core.

segment.source: For Windows 10 Mobile, this setting disables Windows 10 Mobile telemetry.
segment.target: For Windows 10 Mobile, this setting disables Windows 10 Mobile telemetry.

segment.source: Basic
segment.target: Basic

segment.source: Provides only the data vital to the operation of Windows 10 Mobile.
segment.target: Provides only the data vital to the operation of Windows 10 Mobile.

segment.source: This data level helps keep Windows 10 Mobile and apps running properly by letting Microsoft know the device’s capabilities, what’s installed, and whether Windows is operating correctly.
segment.target: This data level helps keep Windows 10 Mobile and apps running properly by letting Microsoft know the device’s capabilities, what’s installed, and whether Windows is operating correctly.

segment.source: This option also turns on basic error reporting back to Microsoft.
segment.target: This option also turns on basic error reporting back to Microsoft.

segment.source: By selecting this option, you allow Microsoft to provide updates through Windows Update, including malicious software protection through the Malicious Software Removal Tool.
segment.target: By selecting this option, you allow Microsoft to provide updates through Windows Update, including malicious software protection through the Malicious Software Removal Tool.

segment.source: Enhanced
segment.target: Enhanced

segment.source: Includes all Basic data plus data about how users use Windows 10 Mobile, such as how frequently or how long they use certain features or apps and which apps they use most often.
segment.target: Includes all Basic data plus data about how users use Windows 10 Mobile, such as how frequently or how long they use certain features or apps and which apps they use most often.

segment.source: This option also lets operating system collect enhanced diagnostic information, such as the memory state of a device when a system or app crash occurs, and measure reliability of devices, the operating system, and apps.
segment.target: This option also lets operating system collect enhanced diagnostic information, such as the memory state of a device when a system or app crash occurs, and measure reliability of devices, the operating system, and apps.

segment.source: Full
segment.target: Full

segment.source: Includes all Basic and Enhanced data and also turns on advanced diagnostic features that collect additional data from devices, such as system files or memory snapshots, which may unintentionally include parts of documents user are working on when a problem occurred.
segment.target: Includes all Basic and Enhanced data and also turns on advanced diagnostic features that collect additional data from devices, such as system files or memory snapshots, which may unintentionally include parts of documents user are working on when a problem occurred.

segment.source: This information helps Microsoft further troubleshoot and fix problems.
segment.target: This information helps Microsoft further troubleshoot and fix problems.

segment.source: If an error report contains personal data, Microsoft does not use that information to identify, contact, or target advertising to users.
segment.target: If an error report contains personal data, Microsoft does not use that information to identify, contact, or target advertising to users.

segment.source: Device retirement
segment.target: Device retirement

segment.source: Device retirement (unenrollment) is the last phase of the device life cycle.
segment.target: Device retirement (unenrollment) is the last phase of the device life cycle.

segment.source: Historically, mobile device retirement has been a complex and difficult process for organizations.
segment.target: Historically, mobile device retirement has been a complex and difficult process for organizations.

segment.source: When the organization no longer needs devices, it must remove (wipe) corporate data from them.
segment.target: When the organization no longer needs devices, it must remove (wipe) corporate data from them.

segment.source: BYOD scenarios make retirement even more complex because users expect their personal apps and data to remain untouched.
segment.target: BYOD scenarios make retirement even more complex because users expect their personal apps and data to remain untouched.

segment.source: Therefore, organizations must remove their data without affecting users’ data.
segment.target: Therefore, organizations must remove their data without affecting users’ data.

segment.source: You can remotely remove all corporate data from devices that run Windows 10 Mobile without affecting existing user data (partial or enterprise wipe).
segment.target: You can remotely remove all corporate data from devices that run Windows 10 Mobile without affecting existing user data (partial or enterprise wipe).

segment.source: The help desk or the devices’ users can initiate device retirement.
segment.target: The help desk or the devices’ users can initiate device retirement.

segment.source: When retirement is complete, Windows 10 Mobile returns the devices to a consumer state, as they were before enrollment.
segment.target: When retirement is complete, Windows 10 Mobile returns the devices to a consumer state, as they were before enrollment.

segment.source: The following list summarizes the corporate data removed from a device when it’s retired:
segment.target: The following list summarizes the corporate data removed from a device when it’s retired:

segment.target: Any data associated with the enterprise-deployed apps

segment.source: Note: All these features are in addition to the device’s software and hardware factory reset features, which users can use to restore devices to their factory configuration.
segment.target: Note: All these features are in addition to the device’s software and hardware factory reset features, which users can use to restore devices to their factory configuration.

segment.source: To specify whether users can delete the workplace account in Control Panel and unenroll from the MDM system, enable the Allow Manual MDM Unenrollment setting.
segment.target: To specify whether users can delete the workplace account in Control Panel and unenroll from the MDM system, enable the Allow Manual MDM Unenrollment setting.
